alert.note: Alert for Ventura County Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued December 04 at 8:26PM PST until December 08 at 3:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM WEDNESDAY TO 3 AM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 4 to 7 feet with local sets to 8 feet, and dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Ventura County Beaches. Highest for northwest and west facing beaches. * WHEN...From 3 AM Wednesday to 3 AM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk for ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.
